name: Gran Hotel Blue Sea Cervantes

reviews.text: I booked a weekend at the Gran Hotel Cervantes from 2nd-5th March 2012, and it was fabulous. The rooms were cleaned spotlessly every day and were very comfortable. The food in the hotel was amasing - we stayed all inclusive and the selection was very good, and the quality even better. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, Good location, friendly staff, good food and good company from the other guests.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the town of Torremolinos, excellent if you arrive by train from Malaga airport, but it is a walk down to the beach but it is no big deal as strolling past bars and shops is what is done on holiday.
reviews.title: Very pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent rooms, gardens, meals and a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. Plenty of sunbeds and chairs and the cleaniness is top notch. Swimming pools outside and one on the room with a sun lounge up there as well.
reviews.title: Good value hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfortable beds and clean bathrooms along with heating/ air-con make for a pleasant room and the balcony gives views of the town and or the coast for miles around.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: I have stayed here and would certainly do so again.
reviews.title: DONT STAY ALL INCLUSIVE

reviews.text: Spent a week in this hotel and was very pleased. The room was a decent size, beds were hard but very comfortable for me - slept great! The pillows were extremely comfy too. Room was clean and cosy. Nice bathroom with bath and shower with great water pressure. The balcony was a good size and we had a room facing the pool - we got the sun in the morning, so the afternoon was cooler - but that was fine for us. We were on the second floor, the noise from the pool area was quite loud if we left the balcony doors open, but when they were shut you heard virtually no noise - even at night with people sitting outside drinking and partying a little. The only downside with our room was that the fridge and safe didn't work - no bid deal really. The hotel wasn't overly busy until Thursdays - thursday through to Sunday evening was very busy as this is when the Spanish come for weekend breaks. They are noisy and quite annoying with the lifts - holding them all the time. That said, the lifts were annoying anyway - 4 lifts that fit 8 people in each - we gave up waiting for them very soon in the week seeing as we were only on the second floor - I wouldn't like to have been on the 7th and walking up every day!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, friendly staff

reviews.text: The hotel has two pools, the garden and roof terrace - both were freezing but that comes with the time of year. There is no bar on the roof terrace, which could be annoying if you want a drink and have to go down 9 floors to get it. Other than that, both pool areas are very nice. On the roof there is a suana and gym as well as the pool and sun loungers.
reviews.title: tourist class

reviews.text: The staff in the hotel were very friendly. Our cleaner was very nice and very good -our room was always lovely.
reviews.title: food crap

reviews.text: The food was nice - breakfast had fresh fruit, tinned fruit, bread, rolls, fresh pancakes, eggs (avoid the scrambled though!), bacon, potatoes, cereal, yoghurts etc. Dinner was ok - a lot of choice, but not much i liked. It could be a bit bland at times. Freshly cooked meat every night, chicken, pork, beef, veil. I didn't like most as they don't cook it long enough so the chicken is quite jelly/rubbery like and the pork was undercooked (my piece was, that's not to say everyone's was). There was pasta, salad, bread, meats, cheese, etc. Ice cream, jelly, cakes - so a lot there.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone really - it is in a great location too - 2 minute walk from the train station (15 minutes from Malaga airport and a lot cheaper than a taxi!), it's in the town centre and the beach is a 15 minute walk down the steps at the bottom of the town. If you don't fancy the steps you can get a lift (you have to pay) or you can walk a little longer way round by going out of the back of the hotel, turning right and walking down one of the roads that way which takes you down hill to the sea front. A little longer and less to see as there are no shops that way, but it avoids the steps!!
reviews.title: Book it now

reviews.text: just returned from the most relaxing care free holiday at this beautiful hotel. i spent 7 days along with my 77 year old mother who also enjoyed her stay from start to finish { both wishing we had booked 10 or 14 nights. We wanted for nothing, our room was situated where we had the benefit of the afternoon sun which made our room bright and warm even on the one cloudy day we had. spotlessly clean throughout with very high standards. cleaners were seen throughout the day freshening bar ,loos, reception area, glass doors. the restaurant was 1st class with one of the best and varied menu i have seen for sometime, and once again staff were on hand keeping self service areas tidy,with fresh food instantly replaced when needed,coffee/tea machines also constantly kept clean, tablecloths replaced with clean ones for every customer,crockery/cutlery/glasses spotlessly clean and the choice of delicious food every lunchtime and dinner was amazing, also serving a very good quality white/red/wine ,
reviews.title: LUCKY ME

reviews.text: After booking this holiday last minute, we were very pleased with the value for money of our stay. The hotel was of an excellent quality. We were more than happy with our room and quality of the communal areas(pool, bars etc). The food was always of a good quality, although not always to my taste.
reviews.title: Top accommodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Defiantly would revisit this area as there was plenty to do. Would like to go during the summer season so I can see the area in its glory as some of the restaurants and shops around are closed during the winter months.
reviews.title: You Decide.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from the Cervantes & like others i read all the reviews about noise, the cold food, rude staff etc. Firstly we take 4 ish holidays a year and all but one are cruises of 4*. In March we pop off for a few days just as a short break and this yr decided on the Cervantes.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.text: Actually nothing bad to say about hotel itself and the staff, but I have a bit different understanding of AI concept... Here you use wifi - you pay, you want orange juice - you pay. That was not very pleasant. Hotel is quite crowded with tourists - in the middle of March. On weekend nights it's quite noisy outside. Not really close to a beach, but location is ok - streets with shops, restaurants and other entertainment options are just round the corner.
reviews.title: All inclusive?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from 4 days at the gran hotel cervantes an i loved it, was a last minute booking so i didnt expect much and was greatly mistaken. I payed a little extra for a room upgrade when booking and it was definately worth it, we had a wrap around balcony with beautiful views of the sea and the mountains.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transport from the airport couldnt have been easier, the train runs from malaga airport every 20mins and 5 clearly signed stops later we arrive in Torremolinos, 1.40Euros, 16mins journey, and walking out of the train station u can actually see the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Location.

reviews.text: Went for the al inclusive option and didnt regret it, breakfast 7am til 10, lunch 1pm til 3 and dinner 7pm til 10, and inbetween that the bar served food and drink from 1pm til 11pm. The food was delicious, we alway had something different each time and never had a bad word to say about any of it, there was something for everyone.
reviews.title: What a view from room 310

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My favourite thing was the roof top pool, no matter how hot the weather it was alway ice cold and competely refreshing when it came time to cool down after sunbathing.
reviews.title: Worth staying again

description: In the commercial leisure centre in Torremolinos, with views of the sea and only 800 m. from the beach. It is 7 km from the Airport and only 300m from the train station. The Hotel has recently been renovated. It offers good transport connections and can be easily accessed. It has a total of 398 rooms which are comfortably equipped and which are adapted to the business client, individuals or families. Gardens, pool area for adults and children, Solarium, Gym, indoor pool heated in winter. Miniclub, Laundry service, Room service, Garage. Restaurant - A la Carte, Restaurant Buffet, Lobby Bar, Pool Bar, Barbecue.
